function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Smart mobility restrictions may not be effectively implemented, leading to continued spread of the virus through transportation modes.","Impact":"Continued spread of the virus and increased risk of infection in high-risk cities.","Mitigation":"Enforcement of strict smart mobility restrictions and travel bans from high-risk cities; implementation of effective monitoring and control measures on transportation.","Technologies":"Contactless payment systems, monitoring and tracking technologies, automated crowd management systems.","People":"General public, travelers, commuters, residents of high-risk cities.","Owner":"Government authorities, transportation agencies, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Negative attitudes towards public transport may persist, leading to decreased usage and increased reliance on private vehicles.","Impact":"Congestion, increased air pollution, and higher risk of transmission in private vehicles due to higher traffic volumes.","Mitigation":"Improving the safety and hygiene of public transport systems, implementing effective communication strategies to rebuild trust in public transport, and promoting alternative active transport modes.","Technologies":"Hygiene monitoring systems, air purification technologies, communication and engagement apps.","People":"Public transport users, commuters, residents of urban areas.","Owner":"Public transportation agencies, urban planning organizations, local government."},{"Description":"Insufficient investment in cycling and pedestrian infrastructure may limit the effectiveness of active transport modes in meeting mobility demands during pandemics.","Impact":"Limited accessibility and affordability of active transport modes, leading to increased reliance on private vehicles.","Mitigation":"Increased investment in cycling and pedestrian infrastructure, implementation of safe and convenient active transport routes, and promotion of active transport as a viable alternative.","Technologies":"Smart urban design and planning software, advanced pedestrian and cyclist safety technologies, mobility analytics.","People":"Cyclists, pedestrians, urban residents, commuters.","Owner":"City planning authorities, transportation agencies, urban development organizations."}]}
